catalog.name: GLEIF Standards
catalog.description: Legal entity identification and corporate hierarchy data from GLEIF.

methodology.name: GLEIF Golden Copy Extraction
methodology.description:
Data sourced from GLEIF golden copy, published daily at https://www.gleif.org/en/lei-data/gleif-golden-copy. Two CSV file types are used:

1. LEI2 (lei2-golden-copy): Legal entity master data containing ~3.2M records with 338 columns covering identity (LEI code, legal name), classification (entity category, legal form, jurisdiction), addresses (legal and headquarters), and registration metadata. Mapped to ores_dq_lei_entities_artefact_tbl.

2. RR (rr-golden-copy): Corporate hierarchy relationship records containing ~463K records with 54 columns covering parent-child consolidation relationships (IS_DIRECTLY_CONSOLIDATED_BY, IS_ULTIMATELY_CONSOLIDATED_BY), fund management, and branch relationships. Mapped to ores_dq_lei_relationships_artefact_tbl.

Diverse subsets (small ~6K entities, large ~15K entities) are extracted using lei_extract_subset.py which selects entities across countries, sectors, entity categories, fund types, and relationship depths. SQL populate scripts are generated by lei_generate_metadata_sql.py which reads the CSV subsets and produces PL/pgSQL blocks with VALUES clauses for idempotent bulk insertion.
